page.title: 04The Cockhall "Digs".
page.content: An enormous tree was blown over on the Eglingham estate near{Cockhall}two years ago. Some{ancient pots}were found and it was discovered that it had been a{burial mound}four thousand years ago. An archiologst took us to see the site and showed us the pots and flints that had been found. The pots had been in pieces and had been stuck together. They had patterns on them but some bits were missing. The dig was on a hill top and a grave had been made to show what it would have looked like originally. They often {buried pots, flints and necklaces}with their dead but the archiologists had not been able to find any beads, nor any bones here. We have visited another site just outside this project's area where four graves, necklaces, pots and arrow-heads have been discovered.
